stories.title: Cost of all U.S. wars versus cost of coronapanic
Protecting Privacy and Enhancing Digital Competition; Congressional Record

stories.text:
On Amazon or such, nothing particularly special or dangerous or even expensive, even not stuff that would be particularly shameful, but stuff that I would prefer not ending up for sale at every data brokers in the world 15min after the checkout.

Obviously, I'll create a temporary email, use a virgin IP and cookies container, but I need to provide my name and address for the shipping.

I was considering obfuscating my name or my address slightly, such that the post can still find me but that exact string match would fail such that data brokers could not match this account with me.

Otherwise there is the PO box system but it's relatively expensive and complicated, enough at least that for the rare time I would need it, it would not be worth it.

How good do you think would be the obfuscation system, would it really resist the data brokers algorithms? Is there something else I could do?

stories.text:
Aspiring to give my aimless tech career some direction, I'd like to get more involved in some tech communities. I've determined part of that is following individuals who are already where I want to be (but that assumes I know where I want to be).

So my question to HN is, who do you follow and why did you start to follow them?
stories.title: Experience Following Individuals in Tech?
